intro: Malvastrum peruvianum var. capitatum, commonly known as the Peruvian mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in coastal areas and can be cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance. The species is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as hibiscus and cotton.
